feed.title: Wallace group
feed.subtitle: Statistics applied to genomics to understand autoimmune diseases

entry.title: Hernandez et al, flashfm fine mapping published in Nat Comms

link.title: Hernandez et al, flashfm fine mapping published in Nat Comms

entry.content:
This study introduces flasfm, a method for general quantitative multi-trait fine-mapping that allows for related individuals and missing trait measurements. https://t.co/PhX4u0Dwnp @JennAsimit @NBanadik @chr1swallace @InesBarroso4 @JanaSoenksen @MRC_BSU @The_MRC @ExeterMed

— Nature Communications (@NatureComms) October 25, 2021
entry.summary: This study introduces flasfm, a method for general quantitative multi-trait fine-mapping that allows for related individuals and missing trait measurements. https://t.co/PhX4u0Dwnp @JennAsimit @NBanadik @chr1swallace @InesBarroso4 @JanaSoenksen @MRC_BSU @The_MRC @ExeterMed— Nature Communications (@NatureComms) October 25, 2021

entry.title: Hutchinson et al, flexible cFDR published in PLoS Genetics

link.title: Hutchinson et al, flexible cFDR published in PLoS Genetics

entry.content:
Absolutely thrilled to see Flexible cFDR published in PLOS Genetics this morning - my third first author paper during my PhD ü•≥üçæhttps://t.co/U7ok70h3g1

— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) October 21, 2021
entry.summary: Absolutely thrilled to see Flexible cFDR published in PLOS Genetics this morning - my third first author paper during my PhD ü•≥üçæhttps://t.co/U7ok70h3g1— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) October 21, 2021

entry.title: new binary cFDR preprint
entry.content:
We have now extended the cFDR framework for binary covariates (e.g. binary functional genomic data) and introduce an all-encompassing user-friendly R package to implement both Flexible cFDR and Binary cFDR! See preprint here: https://t.co/aFw9o8g09y @chr1swallace @MRC_BSU ü•≥

— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) October 25, 2021
entry.summary: We have now extended the cFDR framework for binary covariates (e.g. binary functional genomic data) and introduce an all-encompassing user-friendly R package to implement both Flexible cFDR and Binary cFDR! See preprint here: https://t.co/aFw9o8g09y @chr1swallace @MRC_BSU ü•≥— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) October 25, 2021

entry.title: new BSU director
entry.content:
We are delighted to announce that Professor John Whittaker will become our new Director

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt be more excited to be taking up this position at this time."

— MRC Biostatistics Unit (@MRC_BSU) September 30, 2021

entry.title: Update to coloc
entry.content:
If you like coloc, but hate making a single causal variant assumption, check out this update now published https://t.co/EWdL7yF6Ul with the package available from CRAN https://t.co/jJ5EWB3DDI and vignette https://t.co/sWouPEk5c2. https://t.co/SmjSRDdXTg

— Chris Wallace üá™üá∫ üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà (@chr1swallace) September 29, 2021

entry.title: Our guide to Capture Hi-C analysis using Chicago and companion tools

link.title: Our guide to Capture Hi-C analysis using Chicago and companion tools

entry.content:
Our guide to Capture Hi-C analysis using Chicago and companion tools is finally out.

Lots of new tips, tricks and scripts!@MalyValerie @HelenR_J @paulafpritchett @MonDllRs C.Eijsbouts @williamrorchard @StevenWingett @chr1swallace @jonathancairns
https://t.co/HE777kYyyR

— Mikhail Spivakov (@mikhailspivakov) August 9, 2021

entry.title: New preprint evaluation of biclustering in gene expression data

link.title: New preprint evaluation of biclustering in gene expression data

entry.content:
New preprint by Kath Nicholls carefully compares 4 sets of biclustering algorithms according to their ability to identify structure in gene expression data. Using real data to evaluate biclusters helps go beyond gene-only or sample-only evaluation. https://t.co/cRNNZqUSnl

— Chris Wallace üá™üá∫ üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà (@chr1swallace) December 19, 2020
entry.summary: New preprint by Kath Nicholls carefully compares 4 sets of biclustering algorithms according to their ability to identify structure in gene expression data. Using real data to evaluate biclusters helps go beyond gene-only or sample-only evaluation. https://t.co/cRNNZqUSnl— Chris Wallace üá™üá∫ üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà (@chr1swallace) December 19, 2020

entry.title: New preprint on consensus clustering for Bayesian mixture models

link.title: New preprint on consensus clustering for Bayesian mixture models

entry.content:
Our new preprint is out! By applying consensus clustering to Bayesian clustering models, we sidestep convergence and runtime issues which enables integrative clustering for multiple 'omics datasets @chr1swallace @pauldwkirk @MRC_BSU https://t.co/2n7p8dfobv

— Stephen Coleman (@stcolema1) December 19, 2020
entry.summary: Our new preprint is out! By applying consensus clustering to Bayesian clustering models, we sidestep convergence and runtime issues which enables integrative clustering for multiple 'omics datasets @chr1swallace @pauldwkirk @MRC_BSU https://t.co/2n7p8dfobv— Stephen Coleman (@stcolema1) December 19, 2020

entry.title: Eliciting priors and relaxing the single causal variant assumption in colocalisation analyses

link.title: Eliciting priors and relaxing the single causal variant assumption in colocalisation analyses

entry.content:
The coloc package has had a new release, incorporating new functionality. https://t.co/Q6GasFdt9v

What are the developments?

— Chris Wallace üá™üá∫ üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà (@chr1swallace) April 28, 2020

entry.title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

link.title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

entry.content:
Our work on credible set coverage in genetic fine-mapping is now available! @PLOSCompBiol https://t.co/nVOiIWUlYh We identify systematic bias, discuss the source of the bias and provide a method with user-friendly software to improve coverage @chr1swallace @MRC_BSU @Cambridge_Uni

— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) April 14, 2020
entry.summary: Our work on credible set coverage in genetic fine-mapping is now available! @PLOSCompBiol https://t.co/nVOiIWUlYh We identify systematic bias, discuss the source of the bias and provide a method with user-friendly software to improve coverage @chr1swallace @MRC_BSU @Cambridge_Uni— Anna Hutchinson (@AnnaHutchinson6) April 14, 2020
